There were a number of things that Sarah expected to see in both her life and line of work. But never in a million years did she ever expect to see a real life UFO.

And yet right there, in John's barn, was one such UFO.

The UFO looked like any flying saucer Sarah had seen in fiction: a large, silver, football-shaped object. Four metallic legs were sticking out of holes in the bottom of the craft, holding it up. There were no windows anywhere on the craft.

"I... I can't believe it." Sarah said, utterly stunned.

"I'm just as amazed as you are." John said. "After all these years of seein' lights and hearin' things, I've got an actual UFO sitting in my barn!"

Sarah barely heard him as she walked up to the craft. Her mind was racing with all the possibilites. All the potential contacts, the new technology, the chance to work with species from beyond the stars. She was so distracted by her own thoughts she didn't even realize she reached out to touch the craft.

"Sarah! Wait!" John yelled. But it was too late.

Sarah's hands made contact with the craft. And in a flash of light, she vanished.
----------
It took a few moments for Sarah to regain her sight, but when she did, she was amazed at the site before her.

She must have been inside the spacecraft, because she was surrounded by technology the likes of which she had never seen. Some of it looked familiar, like computers, but much of it was completely unknown.

She also noticed that, despite the outside of the ship being only the size of a large shed, the inside was somehow MUCH larger inside, nearly the size of a football field.

Inside the barn, lying on a bale of hay, was a woman sleeping. Initially, Sarah thought some drunk girl had wandered into John's barn. But then she walked up to get a closer look. To Sarah's surprise, it really was an alien.

The woman was around 6 feet tall. Her skin was a deep shade of purple, she had short orange hair with two antenna sticking out, six pairs of arms, what looked like hooves for feet, and a lizard like tail laying off to the side. She was clad in a tight, silver space suit. The suit lacked gloves.

Another thing Sarah noticed was that the woman was very pregnant. She looked to be around full term with quadruplets. Her belly was almost the size of a beach ball. Her breasts looked to be about K cups.

"I didn't dare wake her up or touch her." John said, staying near the barn door. "Don't know what might have happened."

Sarah looked at the alien woman for a minute, before finally deciding to gently wake her up. She stood next to the alien, and gently started speaking. "Miss, wake up."

Slowly, the alien opened her eyes. Sarah could see her eyes were solid white. The alien gently rose, placing two of her six hands under her belly, and took in her surroundings. She looked at John, then at Sarah.

The alien opened her mouth, revealing a row of razor sharp teeth. Sarah initially thought the alien wanted to eat her, but instead a sound came out of the aliens mouth. It sounded like a cross between a pipe organ and a trumpet.

"Are you trying to speak to me?" Sarah asked. "I don't understand."

The alien looked at Sarah, then pulled a device out of her spacesuits pocket. It looked like a tuning fork. She tapped the fork to her head, then spoke again.

"Apologies." The alien said, now speaking English with British accent. "I've only just arrived on this planet. Who are you?"

Sarah smiled. Actual alien contact. "My name is Sarah. Over there is John Kylan. This is Earth." She said.

"Earth?" The alien asked. "I've heard of this planet before. Surprised to be on it. My name is difficult to pronounce in any language other then mine."

"Well, we need a name." Sarah said. "Why don't we call you Stella?"

The alien blinked. "Is that a joke?" She asked.

"Ok, how about Leah then?" Sarah suggested.

The alien nodded. "Leah sounds good. For as long as I am on Earth, I am Leah."

"Great." Sarah said. "Now, let's get you out of this barn." With that, she reached for one of Leah's hands.

"Wait! Don't-" Leah tried to warn her, but it was too late. Sarah grabbed her upper right arm, and immediatly passed out.

"Oh dear." Leah said. "Mr. Kylan, please fetch some Oxidane." John blinked. Leah sighed. "Water." John nodded and walked to his house. Leah looked at Sarah. "She will be surprised when she wakes up."

By the time they made it back to the meeting point with Jade, Sarah counted 30 new women with big pregnant bellies. They couldn't tell for sure that it was because of them but...it seemed likely. "Why are you two out of breath?" Jade asked, all six hands on her hips. "I know your pregnancies last a long time and you can't exactly hurt them but I wouldn't recommend sprinting all over the place."

"We ran into...a bit of a...problem," Leah gasped out.

"Pregnant...women..." Sarah replied. She may have been at the peak of physical training but running more than a mile while being this pregnant would exhaust anyone.

"Yes, pregnant women," Jade nodded with a smirk, motioning to both of their enormous bellies. "I noticed."

"No, all over the place," Leah said, gulping a big breath of air. "When we passed by women on the way here, they became pregnant. Much more than normal. They were bigger than we were when we first...met."

Sarah blushed, finding herself agreeing with Jade deep down. She had adopted Leah's sister's pregnancy fetish. "B-but putting other women in this position is not good," Sarah blurted out, half trying to convince herself. "You have to admit that at least."

"Sure, sure. I want my pregnant humans well cared for," Jade grinned. "Give me your arms. I can run a test." Both women agreed and Jade gave them a quick scan, looking over the results in her Muserian computer. "That didn't take long. I've got your answer right here."

I'll bet if you check those lovely pregnant women you passed by, you'll find the same thing."

They made it to downtown where newly pregnant women were looking at one another in shock and surprise, stroking their new swollen middles with gasps and coos.

But as soon as they saw Sarah and Leah, they stopped. They had become instantly pregnant with far more fetuses than was normal and here were two of the biggest pregnant women they had ever seen, waddling right up to them. It had to be more than just a coincidence.

"Do you know what is going on with my belly?" a Latina woman in her early 30s asked Sarah, both hands running up and down her swollen belly, pushing far out from her waist and ripping her shirt apart.

"Yes and no," Sarah said, gulping. She was still nervous talking with other people from her years of being shy and judged based on her appearance. "B-but I think we might have some answers. If I could just get everyone's attention..."

"Don't sell yourself so short," Mira said, squeezing her new lover's hand. "Tell them you can fix this."

Sarah took in a cautious breath until she saw everyone looking at her. She had spent so many years being stared at, first for her strange hair and eyes as a kid then for her incredible figure as she got older. But these were not those same kinds of stares. These women were looking at her as an equal, as someone to look up to. They were all the same: pregnant.

"Okay, everyone, please listen!" Sarah said, her voice booming. Years of exercise and training strengthen her diaphragm and increased her lung capacity. "I am a scientist who has been dealing with my own...unusual pregnancy. And as the result of a lab accident," Sarah started to say, looking at Mira. Her girlfriend gave her a little smile and Sarah powered through. "As a result of a lab accident, all fertile women are pregnant." There was a chorus of gasps and murmuring. "T-they may even be my biological babies. We do not quite know yet."

"So what are you going to do about it?" one woman, a Chinese woman in her 40s, shouted back. She was very short so dealt with a disproportionate amount of pregnant weight. "I already have four babies of my own. I don't know what to do with however many more are inside of me now!"

As some other women started to complain, Leah opened her mouth and let out a mighty cry. It stopped everyone in their place and rang out across the city. She tapped her tuning fork against herself and dropped the camouflage. Now people really looked shocked, staring at a purple pregnant alien. "Those singing pipes come in handy at a time like this. Everyone, grab hands." Reluctantly, the pregnant women did as instructed and the hands eventually linked back to Mira, Sarah, and Leah. Then her two antennae began to glow and they could all communicate telepathically.

It is not Sarah's fault. She has been mistreated by you humans all her life but she has always tried to help. And now, you really need her. She's the smartest on this whole planet and you should be thankful you get to even hear her speak to you.

Sarah smiled, glad to hear her new friend from another planet stick up for her. N-now, I have some equipment to do check-ups so I can make sure I know what is going on right now. But in the mean time, please spread the word about what we are trying to do because there are women like you all over the world right now who are scared and confused.

Sarah and Leah's little pep talk seemed to work. In no time, Sarah not only had a few pregnant women to help her out and inspect them to confirm her hypotheses, but word spread all over the planet, in every language. It did not take long for television cameras to go in front of Sarah so she could broadcast her message and solutions across the globe. There was no way to reverse the pregnancies but she had a method to dull the nanobots, ending the growth of their pregnancies.

From there, Sarah worked up a storm, designing new medical procedures for multiple baby delivery that was healthy and safe for all involved. She also examined the brain of her and Leah and found ways to quickly transmit telepathic messages worldwide, provided they were brief. Mira aided her, using her scientific knowledge where it was applicable and using her nanobot-enhanced powers everywhere else. Jade's extensive knowledge of pregnant women also came in handy as Sarah looked for ways to care for the expectant women of the world.

Her work took Sarah far and from the confines of her laboratories, all authority on the matter was ceded to her. The nanobot pregnancies required the women to be pregnant for an additional year, giving Sarah plenty of time to roll out some other ideas she had been thinking about on how to get water and food to everyone, since the global population was about to see a big boom. And she had worked on some ways to set up colonies on the Moon and Mars too, y'know, in her spare time.

Before Sarah knew it, she was essentially the Queen of the planet, her off-handed suggestions being carried out by everyone. By the first few months, poverty and starvation were gone and there was quick headway on rolling back climate change and other forms of environmental degradation. The emphasis put on pregnant women not only ended most institutional misogyny but the telepathic communication Sarah developed helped more people talk with people of a different nationality or culture and everyone came close together, ending war and conflict.

But Sarah was oblivious to much of this as she just kept working, keeping her new friends by her side. Maria and Katie took care of the details of Sarah's new position, not wanting to burden Sarah with the day-to-day of being an empress.

"I think we've made good progress on this," Sarah nodded to herself after three months. "I haven't heard any complaints from those women impregnated by the nanobots."

"Nope, think they're mostly taken care of now," Mira chuckled, finding it cute how humble Sarah was. "But there's still another problem."

"What?" Sarah said, her voice squeaking. "T-they aren't still mad that it turns out they're pregnant with my and Leah's babies, are they?"

"No, not that," Mira chuckled, rolling her eyes. In fact, most people were thrilled at that idea, hoping for genius babies of their own. "No, you and Leah are still supposedly pregnant forever, right?"

"Yep, immortal preggos," Leah sighed. "But...the way things are going, I think we'll have a cure for that too."

"It'll take a lot of time and work but I think we have plenty of time," Sarah chuckled, patting the top of her enormous belly. With the past months, Sarah and Leah were now carrying pregnant bellies the size of a coliseum, the new Earth capital/laboratory being built around them.

"Mmm? And what's that?" Mira cooed, pressing her forehead against Sarah's.

"She said 'not a bad start but it could be a lot bigger.'"

The End

13.content:
Sarah opened the door and observed her visitor. He was a slim, grave looking man in his mid thirties. In his right hand he held a sturdy metal briefcase, and in his left he held his jacket over his shoulder. His black shoes were heavily scuffed and in need of polish, and his black pants had traces of mud around the ankles. His white sleeves were rolled and his arms had smudges of oil; his whole semblance gave the impression of car trouble. On his torso was a mahogany vest over a black tie, loosened in the heat of day. What stood out the most, which gave Sarah pause, was the man’s head. His hair was white, his eyes were purple, and he had a pale complexion. She suddenly realized that she had met him briefly, but only once before.

"Hello, Mr. Mallory. What brings you here at this hour?" Sarah asked. She had recently hired a company to do her DNA profile; Lawrence Mallory was an employee there. Sarah hadn't known much about her family history, and her only living relatives had passed away several years ago. It was only with a vague curiosity that she submitted for the test. Her appearance of white hair and red eyes suggested a form of albinism, but she had never had any of the associated health issues with it. Her sight and hearing were perfectly normal, for instance.

"I have your report," said Mr. Mallory. He indicated the briefcase. He held it tightly, as if his life depended on it. "The findings were quite interesting. Mrs. Havisham normally emails the results to our clients, but I thought I should bring it to you in person."

"Oh,” Sarah breathed, disliking the implication, “Yes, of course. Come on in." Sarah opened the door and guided Mr. Mallory to the living room. The man seemed to be at a loss for words, so Sarah tried to make him feel more comfortable. "Would you like anything to drink?"
"A water, please. My car broke down up the road, and I’ve been trying to get it to run for the better part of an hour."
"I'm sorry to hear that. You didn't have to bring the papers tonight if you had trouble."
"Yes, I did," said Mr. Mallory. There was something greatly concerning him. When Sarah gave him his water, he drank half the glass empty immediately. “I don’t mean to alarm you, Ms. Evans, but our findings might be difficult to hear.” Sarah moved to the sofa opposite of his chair. Now it was time to hear the bad news. Was there a genetic condition that hadn’t manifested yet? Was she related to someone wicked?

"Tell me," said Lawrence Mallory, "what do you think is the inherent nature of human life?"
"I'm sorry?" Sarah asked, bewildered. "What does this have to do with my DNA test, Mr. Mallory?"
"Everything, I’m afraid.”
There was a pause. He didn’t seem to know how to continue. He was waiting for an invitation. Sarah, however, was not up for philosophical debates at this time.
"Mr. Mallory. If it's alright, I think I'll just take my report. My work day is over, and I think you’ll need some time to get your vehicle towed. It’s best to get started on that now before the sun sets."
Mr. Mallory was crestfallen. He had apparently failed at something crucial.
"No, I'm sorry,” he said, “All I meant to ask was whether you think that we are born good or evil?"
Sarah gave a little huff. She wasn’t in the mood for strange questions from strange people. However, she decided to answer briefly.
"Neither, Mr. Mallory. Morality requires an application of virtues, which newborns don't have because they lack knowledge. Thank you for dropping off the report, Mr. Mallory."

Sarah received a large stack of carefully bound folders from the metal briefcase; the weight of it surprised her. She then ushered Lawrence Mallory to the door. Once he passed the threshold, he turned and politely bowed to her. As she closed the door, she heard him whisper, “God bless you, Sarah Evans.”

She returned to the living room and began to examine the contents of the folders. The very first folder, much to her chagrin, was a collection of philosophical and religious essays on morality. “What in the world?” she wondered. At the very bottom of the folder was a collection of essays that she had written herself in graduate school.

The second folder was odder: it held a collection of printed articles from several media outlets. Their focus was primarily on alleged corruption within several religious institutions. Some of the headlines were simply salacious and conspiratorial.

The third folder was a collection of printed emails between members of the DNA company that Sarah had hired. There was apparently some argument going on about their findings. There were so many papers, but at this moment Sarah was simply skimming through everything. She didn’t know what the employees were arguing about, specifically.

The fourth folder was full of references to common genetic information. Most of the papers were centered around reproductive health and gene mutations. The whole experience was becoming weirder and weirder. What in the world was this company doing? Was there anything wrong with her or not?

The fifth folder was about her. Sarah paused at the sticky note on the top of the folder, which read, “Nephilim.” This was a scam, Sarah thought. She skimmed even more rapidly over these final papers, which included a diverse gentic profile. Certain genes, such as the eleventh, apparently had mild mutations. What eventually caught her attention was a section that said “Conclusion.”

“Conclusion: Client is a descendant of Nephilim. DNA profile suggests absence of atresia; ovum were not broken down as the client aged. High levels of Anti-Mullerian hormones. Undefined genetic abnormalities.”

Sarah didn’t quite know what she was looking at. These freaks thought that she was descended from angels and demons? She balked. Had she really wasted her money on some kind of scam like this? With a new feeling of unease she went back to the door and made sure that it was locked. Mr. Mallory was likely just up the road, and she hoped that she wouldn’t see him again. As she checked that the windows were locked as well, she saw something peculiar outside.

There was a blood moon scheduled for tonight. Although it was still the late evening, a peak of the moon was already appearing on the horizon. At least, she thought, she could end the day relaxing with the stars. She went to the kitchen and grabbed her favorite bottle of wine, set some relaxing music, and moved a chair into a prime viewing position. She was a little tired from working today, and she allowed her eyes to close as she was bathed in the moonlight.

Time passed. Sarah made a routine out of stargazing. She always kept so busy with her research projects that she seldom had time to relax. This was one of the few ways that she knew how to let go of her troubles and stress. Tonight, as the sun set and the sky turned black, the blood moon was an exquisite sight. She felt warm and elated looking at it, her imagination wandering into sweet nothings.

For a moment she felt a little nauseous and dizzy, and positioned herself more comfortably in the chair. That wasn’t enough, though, and she went to get a light blanket and a footrest. Once more, she attempted to let her mind drift into a peaceful bliss, but something was still nagging at her. A mild queasiness and rumble in her stomach; when she placed her hand on it the sensation went away. Regardless of her discomfort, she inevitably drifted into sleep, unaware that something unusual was occurring within her.

On the other side of town, Lawrence Mallory was also observing the blood moon. He was beset by grave doubts: what is humanity’s nature, what is its purpose, and other complicated thoughts.

“Every man’s soul is as a stone. Whether one bears the beauty of obsidian, or the strength of granite, I know that by our actions we chip away at our basic exteriors. We do this either with care or wantonness, but each crack at ourselves creates a more clear form to be presented. If I crack my smile, will I make friends? We use these sculptures to connect ourselves with other men, in hopes that others can see these forms with half closed eyes. For our outer shells, if not likewise maintained, may betray the inward desire of our hearts. As well, the hollow men can use their shells for perfidy and deception.

What’s more, can I properly carve myself into an Adonis before I have the strength to bear the chisel? In early days it’s with a mentor’s assisting hand that I can wield this instrument, and only with his guidance that I know where to hit the point. If then I am led false, can I correct the error? Even worse, what if it be as the cynic suggests, and not every soul be similar, but many as loose as sand? Can we then understand the same tools, and does that mean that we can be predisposed to destined evil? I pray to you, God, and beg your forgiveness for my doubt. For my part, I can only at this time have faith that good parents will raise good children, and I pray for your blessings on this earth and its people. I also pray that you watch after Ms. Sarah Evans, whom I fear will face many trials ahead. I ask you to protect her from temptation, and to deliver her from evil. Amen.”

1322323.content:
...research her bloodline. Sarah needed knowledge on how to combat this or even reverse it. There were many reasons she wanted to shrink down, the most important being that she was overdue to spawn the legions of Hell. So that was a priority in her mind.

"But where do I even start?" Sarah exclaimed. "I don't think I'm qualified to find out anything. Hell I don't think I know where to start."

Sarah sat down on a chair, which caused it to creak under her weight. Her stomach groaned with little tykes inside of her. Sarah grimaced before a quick thought flashed into her mind.

"My grandmother's photobook!" Sarah cried. "I know she had some addresses and notes and whatever else. There has to be something for me to use."

Sarah wobbled as she got up and waddled up her stairs. It was a tight and difficult journey but eventually she got up there. Going towards her room, Sarah's search for the book was straining on the large girl's body. More in tune with a slimmer body, a five-minute search turned into a fifteen minute game of "can Sarah make sure she doesn't fall over?"

Sarah eventually found the fruits of her labor as she brought up a green book with a picture of her younger self. Her mother smiled gently in the background. Sarah opened the book and stared at all the memories inside of it. Pictures of her younger grandmother all the way to the first years of Sarah's life. A thought quickly passed through her head, that she needed to continue to fill the book out of these days. Sarah shook that thought out and continued all the way to the back. There she saw what she was looking for.

Her grandmother was an avid explorer, alongside her grandfather. Notes,mementos, and a plethora of other things one could've possibly fit in a eight inch thick book. Some mementos were easily discernible, such as a picture of France's catacombs.Others not so much, such as a picture of a blurry animal.Her grandmother never did explain what some of these cryptic things were, but the ones she did explain always delighted younger Sarah. Sarah's eyes searched for something related to her current situation but most were about how her grandmother's exploration of the world. Fearing that she would get no anywhere, Sarah soon calmed down as she saw a familiar note. It had a symbol that always frightened her when she was a young girl,so much so that she never could ask her grandmother what it was.

It was a horned beast she couldn't equate to anything on Earth. Steam blew from its nose and spikes were tied around the horns.

"Its probably this one." Sarah thought. "Unless there's a note about fluffy bunnies behind it."

Sarah ran her finger across it and yelped as she felt something prick her finger. She pulled her hand back shaking it in pain. Her eyes looked down though in wide-eyed shock as the note glowed briefly before opening. Behind the closed flap were the following words:

"Dear daughter, granddaughter, or any numbered descant of my line.

I fear that if you're reading this that the curse of our bloodline has appeared inside of you. Hopefully this story can help you in the coming da-"

Sarah grimaced as she saw her grandmother's explanation was etched out. Which didn't make sense seeing as that would imply someone had access to her grandmother's book. Thankfully it seemed that at least some information was still there.

"and I hope my story will ease your mind. For further assistance head to this address."

Sarah quickly jotted the note's coordinates down, closed the book, and read the address. Hopefully she could get some answers there.

14.content:
Sarah looked in confusion between the hooded figures, her eyebrow, as white as the rest of her hair, raising slowly. "Can I help you?"

A few of the men looked between one another before turning back to Sarah. "Just as it was prophesied: the look of a demon, the body of a warrior, and the voice of an angel." Sarah's cheeks turned a little rosy. She already didn't like talking to strangers and the only thing that made her more uncomfortable was having strangers talk about her appearance. Sarah knew her looks drew...attention but it didn't mean everyone had to make their opinions known about it!

"If you don't have anything else to say," Sarah fumed, ducking her head back inside her house, prepared to slam the door behind her.

"Wait!" one of the men said, holding out his hand, catching Sarah's attention. She stopped just before the door hit the latch and looked back out. "I apologize, we were not clear before. We do not mean you any harm. In fact, it is very important that we talk with you."

Sarah crossed her arms under her heaving breasts. "Alright, fine. What do you want to say to me?"

"We are supporters and clergy of the ancient diety, Olania," another man said, stepping forward.

Sarah gulped. "Oh, you're door-to-door religious preachers. Well, I don't want any pamphlets or newsletters, thank you."

"We are not here to preach or convert to you," the first man said. "We are part of an order that reaches back through the millennia and we must keep our task in order to keep the chain of our works unbroken."

"You're starting to sound a little crazy," Sarah said. "And I've never heard of this 'Olania' god you're talking about."

"She has long vanished from the memory and history of humanity, but she once walked across the globe, visiting humans and spreading fertility all around," another man said. "Without her, mankind would never have made it."

"Fertility?" Sarah said, taking a step back. Were these nuts trying to have sex with her? Sarah may have taken martial arts as a way to exercise, but she was more than capable of taking out a small group of weirdos in robes with a few quick kicks.

"Perhaps we should wait until our leader arrives to explain more," one of the hooded men said to his companions. "Then things will be made clear to her."

"Agreed," the first man said, and the group took steps back, returning to the semi-circle they were in when Sarah opened the door. "We will wait for our leader to explain all to you. Then your questions will be answered."

"Well where's your leader?" Sarah asked, annoyed at herself for getting so curious about all of this.

The men mumbled among one another before returning to their stoic arraignment. "Bad traffic."

Just great, Sarah thought, closing the door and walking back into her living room. A bunch of weird cultists who carpool to young women's homes. At least they're not doing anything now. After checking that the door was locked, Sarah went to her bathroom and took off her sweatshirt and bra, looking over her still-sweaty body. It was too late for a shower — they made it hard for her to fall asleep for some reason — so Sarah wet a rag in the sink and ran it over her arms. It left a wet sheen in place of the glistening left by her sweat, but at least she felt much cooler and not as gross afterward.

Each pass by the rag let Sarah feel the tone of her muscles, thick when pressed against but soft and smooth when traced. She lifted her arm to wipe the sweat from her armpit, her equally-detailed back and shoulder muscles flexing in the mirror. Sarah wasn't a very vain person. Years of being teased about her ghoulish eyes and hair followed by unrelenting flirtation and pick-up lines did away with that. But as Sarah started on her path to her numerous PhDs, she took a more positive approach to her appearance and considered her muscles to be a sign of the hard work she'd put in to both her studies and her health.

Sarah heard the doorbell ring again and groaned, throwing her sweatshirt back on and zipping it up tightly to not let the hooded guys on to the fact that her bras were now out in the open. "Still here?"

To Sarah's surprise, there was another hooded figure in front of the rest of the semi-circle. Well, that was't the surprising thing. What was surprising was that this one had the hood down, revealing that she was a woman unlike the rest of them. She also had a pregnant belly, sticking out prominently from behind her cloak.

"Hello," the woman smiled, taking a few slow steps toward to the door. "Your name is Sarah, correct?"

"Yes," Sarah said quietly.

"My name is Nora and I'm the chief cleric of the Supporters of Olania. I'm sorry I wasn't here earlier, but now that I am here, I think I can answer all of your questions," Nora said. "May I come inside?"

Sarah couldn't bring herself to leave a pregnant woman outside, so she let Nora get into the house, moving surprisingly quickly for someone with a pretty big belly. "So, what is all of this about? What does some ancient fertility god have to do with me?"

Nora chuckled and turned to Sarah. "They explained a bit of it to you, it sounds like. Well I should clarify one thing. Olania wasn't a fertility goddess. She was just a goddess of pregnancy."

That explains one thing, Sarah said, blushing a little. "W-well, thank you for straightening that out. Now, what does this have to do with me?"

"Do you believe that Olania is real?" Nora asked.

Sarah shrugged. "Not really. I'm not going to cast aspersions on anyone's religion, but this is the first time I've heard about it."

"Perhaps I should give you some more background, then," Nora said. "Imagine the first humans. No written history, no knowledge beyond what they can immediately see. Now imagine one of them starts to get a growing belly. That would come as a shock, wouldn't it?"

"I guess so," Sarah said.

"If you didn't know what pregnancy was, it would come as a big surprise. Imagine going through childbirth without knowing what's going on. Imagine being the first woman to give birth to twins and the confusion that would entail. There were many things humans couldn't have known about pregnancy, but that is why Olania came to us. She taught humanity about pregnancy and, through her magic, pregnancy has remained with us," Nora said.

"But she's not here anymore," Sarah said.

"No, and that is where you come in. To maintain her magic, Olania reincarnates among humanity every few centuries. And that's who you are, Sarah," Nora said.

Sarah looked at her, confused. "I'm some sort of pregnancy goddess?"

Nora nodded. "And our task is to take the final step in letting the magic continue onto you." She tucked her arms into her cloak, opening it up and revealing that her pregnant belly was, in fact, a stone cast of a belly. "This was a belly cast of the first reincarnation of Olania, thousands of years ago. Please, place your hand here."

Sarah hesitated before touching her palm to the stone belly. Nora sighed and smiled, closing her cloak again. "It is done."

"That's all?" Sarah said, raising her eyebrow again.

"Yes, we will take our leave now, although I expect we will meet again some day," Nora said, bowing. "We are now, after all, your followers and supporters."

As quickly as they came, the hooded worshipers of an ancient pregnancy goddess were gone and Sarah was back alone in her house. With nothing else to do, Sarah headed to her bedroom, undoing her ponytail and shaking her brilliant white locks out before slipping into bed, clad in just her underwear.

Slowly, she opened her eyes, seeing a calm sky above her and a wide, endless meadow at her feet. As Sarah looked around, she felt strong, warm arms wrap around her.

"Hello, my child," a woman's voice said. Its beauty and gravitas shook Sarah to her core as she turned around to see the woman, her skin shining like bronze, holding her.

"D-do I...know you?" Sarah said. As she asked, the woman lay Sarah against a massive, soft seat. Sarah soon realized it was the woman's gigantic pregnant belly, shining and smooth like the woman's skin.

"You will," the woman said, kissing her on the forehead. "And I cannot wait to get to know you better. I could not ask for a better child to carry on my work."

Sarah felt a rustling inside her own stomach and reached down to feel. She looked back up at the dazzling woman. "Olania?"

The woman nodded again and put her hand over Sarah's six-pack stomach. Her touch was electric and it woke Sarah from her dream.

Sarah looked around her bedroom, taking in deep breaths. "What a weird dream," she said to herself groggily, looking over at her clock. Seven a.m., right on time to start the day. Sarah sat up and stretched out her back, feeling strangely heavy for some reason. Then she looked down and saw the source: she was pregnant. Very pregnant.

144.content:
Now, Sarah was a smart girl. Her wall of Doctorates could attest to that. Sarah didn't get those by just buying of the Internet either. No, Sarah was scary smart, and always went for the most practical, sensible solution, and never let her emotions cloud her judgment and her thinking processes.

Sarah screamed her head off.

         She tried jumping out of bed in shock, but the boulder of flesh that was her once toned stomach made sure that she wouldn't be able to get out of bed without some serious effort. Sarah wasn't a pushover though, and she was getting a serious boost of adrenaline thanks to her little episode. With a little exertion, (and five minutes of panic filled flailing), Sarah managed to heave her hefty frame off her mattress, it's springs groaning in response, and waddled her way over to her mirror.
         The sight that greeted her was beyond belief. The body in the mirror certainly was not the the one Sarah went to bed with. For starters, she was wearing underwear when she went to sleep. This body was most definitely naked. Sarah looked back to see that her bra and panties and been ripped and popped off her body in her sleep. As Sarah turned back around to the mirror, the culprits of this heinous undergarment crime jiggled back into her view.
         Sarah's hips had widened quite a bit, and Sarah could feel that her butt had expanded enough to make her think for a second that she was grabbing a pair of luscious clouds. Further up her body, her ass's two accomplices had exploded out of their 36DD prison. Sarah guessed she had jumped up a cup size. All of this, though, wasn't what made Sarah gape. That honor was held by her belly.
         It was massive. In fact. it couldn't fit into the mirror, it was so big. Her stomach extended in front of her, a mass of flesh that, despite its hugeness, stayed firm when Sarah poked and prodded it. She noticed that the belly had a distinct lack of stretch marks anywhere, but it was a small thought compared to the overwhelming sight of a giant belly where her abs used to be.
         It was like there was a whole other person standing in the mirror, and that Sarah was only looking through her eyes for a day. But there was no mistaking that shock of pure white hair and bright red eyes, and when she reached her hand to touch her new "additions", the woman in the mirror had the audacity to copy her exact movements. There was no mistaking it, this was her body.
          Despite all the evidence to the contrary, Sarah was still in denial about her condition. "
Maybe I caught a virus, a bug. Maybe I have a genetic disorder I wasn't aware of. Something has to explain this!" she said, her mind racing through its encyclopedic knowledge of medicine and disease to find anything that could explain what happened to her, but nothing was coming to her, and that was a rare thing indeed.
"I just can't be, It's impossible." she stated.

         And that's when Sarah felt a kick within her womb, and another on the opposite side, and a third kicking her in the ribs, and she screamed some more.

__________


         It took an hour for her to calm down enough for the rational side of her mind to take over. Once she was in control, Sarah started to take stock of her situation and figure out what she could. Her PhD. in Obstetrics and Gynecology told her that, judging from the fetal movement, there seemed to be three children within her womb. But she looked bigger than any woman pregnant with triplets she had seen. Sarah guessed that, that since most Triplet pregnancies are full term at 36 weeks, the three little stomach invaders inside her must have somehow developed beyond full term. She guessed she might be full term with triplets.
         "Oh, more than full term my child. You are quite overdue. 42 weeks, in fact."
          Sarah turned around as fast her gravid body allowed, uttering a shriek as she did so, to see the woman sitting on her bed. It was the woman from her dream last night.
         "Olania", Sarah said, the name escaping her lips without her even thinking of it.
         The goddess smiled, "Yes, my child."
         The voice the was the exact same one Sarah had heard in her dream. It was still just as beautiful, melodious, and dignified as she remembered. That would have been okay, if that voice hadn't just come out of Sarah's body.
          In her Dream, the goddess had been beautiful, but, she couldn't exactly remember what she looked like. Now here she was, right before her, and Sarah saw that Olania looked exactly like her! She felt as if she was looking in a mirror, only the mirror was behind her, and this body in front of her did not copy her movements like that bitch in the other mirror. Olania had every little feature identical to Sarah, right down to her snowy hair and devilish eyes. But there was something different that set Olania apart from Sarah, a certain...Fullness. She had a natural glow about her, and she seemed to radiate contentment and confidence as she stood up from the bed effortlessly, and somehow managed to proudly, and sexily, strut and waddle at the same time over to Sarah.
         Sarah had finally had enough, and just before Olania was about to speak again, she let loose. "You did this!", Sarah said, pointing to her belly,"you made this way! I have had enough of this morning! I am not ready to be a mother, I can barely deal with small conversation, let alone raising three kids! This can't happen, Its impossible! I demand that youuUUGMPH!"
          Sarah's ranting and steam venting was cut short as Olania suddenly dove in and kissed Sarah. And oh boy, what a kiss! Sarah had never been kissed like that before! It was intense and reserved at the same time. Her lips were supple and soft and everything Sarah could ever want in a kiss. As soon as the God's lips met hers, Sarah melted into the sweet curves of the woman in front of her, as much as both of their pregnant bellies would allow. All troubles and worries were out her mind, and the only thing left was that kiss. The rational side of her mind was now questioning her sexuality, the emotional side only craved more of this kiss, and the immature side giggled at the thought that this could be considered masturbation.

         Their lips parted, and all Sarah was capable of saying was, "Wow".
         The Goddess giggled, a sound that instantly made Sarah feel at ease and comforted, for apparent reason. "I'm glad I can still deliver, even after all these years. But, don't get too excited there honey, it was a one time deal, I, or You, or Us, don't swing that way. Although I am glad to see that those People are getting more support out there today. I may not be a goddess of love, but that doesn't mean I can't support all forms of it."
          Sarah blinked, the Goddess's voice changed. It wasn't that it sounded any different, but that instead her tone was different. She was using modern terminology, making references to current issues, even being sarcastic and cracking jokes. All things an "ancient" goddess usually didn't do. Sarah questioned her about this, and she smiled.
         "You didn't think I kissed you just because did you? No, that was to catch up. I kissed you so I could see your memories and knowledge to learn everything you know about this new time and everything I have missed before, and my must say, you humans have been busy! I also must know how to act accordingly in this new time. A goddess has to stay in touch with her worshipers if she wants to be worshiped, and that means staying current with their lives and problems, so you can answer their prayers correctly."
         Sarah was surprised, and little hurt, though she couldn't understand why, that that kiss wasn't for pleasure. And Olania did seem to talk like a normal person now, no more, "my child"s and whatnot. Sarah opened her mouth, but she was interrupted by a horrible realization. A quick look at the clock confirmed her fears. "Oh my god, I have to go to work!" she exclaimed, "But I can't go in like this!" she looked down at her expanded gut, one of the children moved within her.
         Olania glared, "and what's wrong with 'this'?" she said, rubbing her own fleshy orb.
         "The problem is that I wasn't like 'this' yesterday! I gotta call in sick!" Sarah replied as she waddled to the phone. Luckily, Sarah had plenty of personal and sick days on account that Sarah was Incredibly healthy and had next to no social life. With a quick call, Sarah was free for the day to figure out what was going on, whatever that was.

         Sarah waddled her away over to her closet to find what could fit her new physique. She was dismayed to find that her favorite outfit was the only thing that fit her, and nothing else, not even any of her undergarments. The reason the big hoody and baggy sweatpants were her favorite was because they hid her rather gorgeous body from onlookers and gawkies, and the hood and some sunglasses hid her more noticeable facial features. But now the prized out fit was the only thing that fit her, and it barely did that, the sweatpants were pulled tight over her new hips and bigger butt, outlining them perfectly in the garment.
         The hoody was stretched across her new stomach very tightly, and she could feel a small strip of flesh poking out from underneath the overtaxed article of clothing. Her breasts didn't help either, as for them to be comfortable, she had to unzip her hoody to reveal quite a bit of cleavage, something that was not good considering she had no bra on, and was a jiggle away from revealing quite a lot of herself. After a long battle with said outfit, Sarah managed to get to clothing on and make it look as conservative as it could, Sarah looked at her new self in the mirror, and sighed, already tired even though she only woke up two hours ago.
         "What the hell am I going to do?", Sarah said.

1441.content:
Sarah wrapped her hands around her belly and felt the three babies — her children — kicking inside her. Sarah had never thought about having any kids of her own because the idea scared her too much. She remembered being a little kid on the playground and having others tease her about her other-worldly looks. If she had children, would they get tortured the same way? Then again, Sarah's parents and relatives didn't have her icy white hair or burning red eyes. Maybe her children would look normal and be afraid of her.

The thought of having her own children feel alienated from her made a shiver of panic run down Sarah's spine. Standing up as straight as she could, which was certainly restricted by her pronounced curves, Sarah took in a deep breath, feeling it travel down her throat and fill her entire body before slowly discharging it. Years of learning martial arts helped Sarah learn these kinds of relaxing techniques when her social anxiety built up. Now after a few deep breaths, Sarah broke down what she needed to think about.

"Okay, first things first: I don't want to be pregnant," she said, putting her hands on her belly and looking down at it, getting an eyeful of her cleavage at the same time. "And if I'm 42 weeks pregnant, I could go any minute. I should have my mucus plug checked but...I'd better stay away from any doctors or laboratories aside from my own. It would be hard to explain my sudden maternity, and even harder to explain how I got this far along with triplets."

Sarah turned back to her bed and saw that the mysterious woman, Olania, was gone. Whether she was even real or not, Sarah had a hard time concluding. She did look exactly like Sarah, after all, so it could have been an out-of-body experience or a hallucination triggered by seeing her unfamiliar body in the mirror. In all of this, there was only one real, consistent factor: the cult.

The last people Sarah met were the cultists, the Supporters of Olania, and they talked an awful lot about pregnancy and their pregnancy god. One of them, Nora, even said that Sarah would have to take on her role and showed her a fake pregnant belly cast. Sarah felt her own belly enough to know that it wasn't a fake, but figured they could give her some answers or at least put her on the right path.

"But how to find them?" Sarah thought, crossing her arms and finding to her slight annoyance that her belly made for a good shelf. "Sarah, you are a smart woman. You can figure this out."

Now came the tricky part. To look for these people, Sarah would need to...go outside. A difficult enough task for someone as startling in appearance as Sarah, but with her new features, it would be even more shocking. She put on a pair of thick sunglasses and tied her white hair in a ponytail to make it less noticeable. The belly, the breasts, and the ass she couldn't do much about.

With a deep breath, Sarah headed out the door and waddled toward the city. It took some getting used to for Sarah to waddle and found just walking around with a belly her size was a workout on its own. Sarah knew she'd gone through more rigorous exercise, though. She'd earned a black belt in kenpo, was working on becoming a seventh degree black belt in karate, won an amateur boxing tournament when she worked on her neurology degree at Johns Hopkins, and was even offered a prajiad by her muay thai instructor. No magical pregnant belly was going to stop her.

It certainly wasn't easy, though. Her belly wasn't just weight. The squirming little ones inside her kept pressing against her bladder and pelvis, adding some particularly sharp bursts of discomfort. Her hoodie also rolled up every now and then, leaving Sarah to struggle and try to pull it down, lest too much of her bare stomach be revealed.

Plenty of her skin seemed to be revealed already, as she got lingering looks everywhere she went. Most people were too slack-jawed to give her any cat-calls as they looked at her humongous belly size, her ample, inviting chest, or her pronounced ass barely tucked into her sweatpants. A few guys managed to jeer and tell her to stop by after she had her kids.

"I...I don't believe it," one man said as she walked by. "Doctor? You...you wrote practically half the articles in the last New England Journal of Medicine!"

Sarah blushed and tried to waddle more quickly. She got plenty of attention for her looks, both the demonic side and the curvy side, but Sarah was also a near-celebrity in the scientific community for her work in so many disciplines. Doctors, physicists, chemists, mathematicians all knew about her. "Sorry, you must be thinking of someone else," Sarah managed to squeak out as she walked away.

"No, I'm sure it's you," he said, easily catching up to her in a few steps. Sarah underestimated how much this belly was restricting her. "Please, your paper on the possibilities of vertical endoscopic suturing was brilliant. I'm the head of surgery at-"

"Look, sir," Sarah said, turning to him aggressively. "This doctor you think I am: does she have a big, fat belly?"

He looked down, eyes moving between her breasts and belly. "W-well, no, I hadn't heard anything about-"

"Then she's not me," Sarah said. "Goodbye." It wouldn't be long until people knew that the super-genius, multi-PhD holding Sarah was, in fact, hugely pregnant. Word about her traveled fast and she saw enough people snapping pictures of her on her walk to know that word would get out. Sarah had similar press everywhere she went. Scientific websites included updates on her latest papers and degrees, martial arts websites detailed her latest belt achievements, and other, sketchy local forums had people collect photos of the "Sexy Monster Woman."

Sarah started rubbing her belly, feeling kicking starting up again. "You'd probably get sick of seeing your mom's face everywhere on the internet, wouldn't you?" she said to her hugeness, her cheeks blushing again as she realized that she was talking to her swollen uterus, full of children that weren't there the day before.

Before long, Sarah was at the city's main library branch, sweat accumulating all over her sweatshirt and on her forehead. "A little hot for those clothes, isn't it dear?" the woman at the desk said.

"Only thing that fits," Sarah said with a deep breath, fanning her chest.

"I'll bet," the woman said, adjusting her glasses at Sarah.

Sarah went through the archived newspapers and city documents, looking for any information about the Supporters of Olania or any similar cult. After a while of getting up slowly, stretching her back, and even bumping her bump on the table a few times, the librarian started bringing books and newspapers over to her. Sarah smiled and thanked the middle-aged woman. In college she always had guys and girls running over one another to get her a pen or a beaker, but this felt much nicer. The librarian, who was in a "Boston marriage" in her younger years, enjoyed helping Sarah too for her own reasons.

Sarah's monstrous intellect let her draw an assuring lead and she waddled back out the door, checking out a book on lamaze the librarian snuck in with her newspapers as well. A small blurb on a few papers pointed to a cult in the area and some other photographs let Sarah spot Nora. What she didn't notice was that the librarian's belly had gotten a little bigger and rounded since Sarah walked in the door and was slowly growing.

Sarah waddled onto the West Street Co-Op Farm, walking through the accompanying market and feeling a strange twinge of hunger for very odd, very specific foods, until she got to the well-sized farm in the back. More like a garden with food, really. Lots of different fruits and vegetables were growing all around, with women of varying ages picking and cultivating the plants, wiping the sweat from their foreheads. "Hi," Sarah said to one woman. She turned, only seeing Sarah's belly thanks to her crouching position, and turned her head up until she could also see Sarah's breasts. "Is Nora here?"

The woman silently pointed to a pear tree where Nora was standing on a ladder. "Nora?"

Nora turned around and gasped when she saw Sarah standing there, belly prominently on display. "Oh my God, the prophecy was true!"

"Yep, it's real alright," Sarah said, patting her tummy. "And I think we need to talk about it."

Nora got on her knees. "I am honored...may I...feel it?"

Sarah sighed. "I-I'd really rather you n-"

"Please, my lady," Nora said, bringing her forehead to the ground. "To touch the womb of the incarnation of Olania would be...what my whole life has been for."

"If I let you touch my....my belly, will you promise to talk to me about all of this?" Sarah said, looking around at all of the other women in the field looking at them. "In private?"

"Of course," Nora said, bringing her head up and resting her hand on Sarah's belly, not daring to rub. "Incredible..."

As she rested her hand on Sarah's belly, Nora's own belly began to swell every so slightly.

"Now, we need to talk," Sarah said before a strong kick rolled her sweatshirt up some more, giving Nora a full-frontal view of Sarah's bare skin and popped-out belly button. "And fast."

14413.content:
Sarah was incredibly uncomfortable. She didn't even let her closest friend get this close to her, let alone someone she just met yesterday. For most of her life, when people got this close to her, she was either mocked and, in extreme cases, shoved and hurt, or, when she got older, flirted with and, in extreme cases, groped. Yet here she was, letting said stranger touch her newly expanded stomach. Nora was rubbing her hands over every inch of her fleshy orb, as if desperately trying to find some hidden section of flawless skin that she hadn't yet placed her hands on. All in the name of finding the answer to why she has suddenly become a mother to be of triplets, and how NOT to be an actual mother of triplets.
         "This is truly glorious!" Nora said in a tone that one usually reserves for when they see a truly breath taking sight, like the Grand Canyon, or the Aurora Borealis. Sarah looked to to see that the woman had tears welling up in her eyes.
         "I am actually touching the womb of Olania! Oh the children that must have been brought into the world from this womb, the lives it has given us! I can receive no greater gift than this. Thank you my goddess!" Nora said, resting her head against her idols' belly and feeling the children within.

         "Oookay, I let you feel me up, you can get off now", Sarah said, her anxiety finally winning out over her need for answers, "this is a public place and people are staring."
         And staring they were. As Sarah looked around the field, she saw that every farmhand had their eyes on her. Sarah once again wished she had managed to get that human turtle hybrid experiment funded. That way, she could give herself a shell, and hide in it.
         "You'd think that an experiment that could actually make the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles would rake in the grant money", Sarah thought to herself as the, now steadily growing, cultist in front of her struggled to her feet, "stupid science ethics code, getting in the way of my anxiety and all that." Sarah giggled at her own little private sense of humor. If she would ever bother to say them out loud without her fear of being rejected, she would realize she is actually quite funny.

         "You shouldn't try to hide your body in a shell, you are beautiful and, more importantly, fertile. Be proud of your womanly body", Sarah heard her voice say, even though she hadn't said the words, "besides, you don't look good in green, or a blue, red, purple, or orange mask for that matter. I see you as more of a 'little black dress and glasses' type of gal."

          Sarah looked towards the source of the voice to find herself standing behind Nora, stark naked.
         "Olania?", Sarah asked.
         "Cowabunga", the goddess replied, wiggling her thumb and pinky in a surfers' salute. Sarah waddled her way over to the look alike, strutting past a confused Nora.
         "Why do you have my voice now? What happened to your godly vocal chords? One minute, you are sounding soft, melodious, you know, like a god would sound. And now, I feel like I'm talking to myself. What gives?" Sarah asked. The Sarah impersonator tilted her head, a notion the original was fond of doing when puzzled, which only served to enrage her more.
         "Because I am you, of course I would sound like me." Olania said, like she was completely dumbfounded as to why she shouldn't sound exactly like Sarah.
         "No, you are you", Sarah said pointing a finger at Olania, "I am me.", pointing the finger back at herself. Olania nodded in agreement.
         "Exactly, you are me, and I am you", she said, mimicking Sarahs' finger pointing.
         "That's not what I said and.. errrgh!" Sarah was almost to the point of pulling out her hair, or maybe Olanias', if it would get this goddess or whatever she was to talk straight.

         "My goddess, do you always talk to yourself, or are the unborn speaking to you?" Nora chimed in.

         Sarah did actually have a habit of talking to herself, but this was one of the few times she wasn't. Didn't Nora see the exact clone of Sarah right in front of her, in the nude?
         "Of course she can see me, I'm standing in front of her in an ill fitting hoodie and sweatpants" Olania said, now apparently able to read minds, and she still thought she was Sarah. If it was physically possible, steam would have been coming out of her ears at this point.
         "Once again, I was not referring to whether or not she could see me, but you.", Sarah gritted through her teeth. She turned to face Nora. "Nora, do you nooOOOH MY GOD!!!"

         Sarah turned to face Nora, only to find that, while she and whatever is next to her were arguing, Nora had been growing. A lot. Her farmers overalls had long since come undone, and the dirty, white t-shirt had bunched up to reveal a pregnant belly that was bigger than Sarahs'! When Sarah looked back at this incident later, she realized that, while she didn't know how, she had somehow known that Nora was carrying quadruplets in her womb. But that was the furthest thing from her mind at that point. It wasn't for Nora, she looked down and apparently noticed her growth spurt for the first time.

         "Oh my god!" She exclaimed.
         "I am so sorry! Did I do that? I am terribly sorry!" Sarah frantically apologized. Noras' reaction, however, was not what Sarah expected.
         " What are you apologizing for? The Goddess has blessed me with children for my undeserving womb! I shall cherish these infants long as they reside in me! I thank you for your kind gift!" She said, tears now pouring down her cheeks.
         "Did I give you those children? How in the world could I have done that?" Sarah said, exasperated.
         "Well, she did rub our belly", Olania said, " that's just begging for her to get impregnated, and all she really had to do was be around us." Sarah turned around back to the goddess.
         "So what, I'm pregnancy radioactive? women get pregnant just by being near me?" she screeched. Olania nodded.
         "Pretty much. That is one our most basic godly powers I'm so glad I am manifesting our powers so early! I am really adjusting to this new form!" While she babbled on. Sarah was lost in shock. How many people had she impregnated just traveling to this place? How many lives had she forever changed.
         "This is just too much! I gotta have some answers" Sarah said, turning around quickly to face a potential source of answers. Nora was eagerly rubbing her own expanded stomach, too focused on it to notice the Goddess "talking to herself."

         Sarah may have turned a bit too fast, as her newfound center of gravity, and lack of vision on anything below her stomach, made it very easy for her foot to trip on a root. As she stumbled, Nora temporarily managed to break free from her daze and catch her patrons' fall. Sarah managed to grab hold of Nora as well, with one hand on the cultists' shoulder, and the other falling upon her pregnant stomach, unaware of the consequences.
         With a sudden jolt of energy, Sarah cold suddenly feel herself growing. A quick look down confirmed her suspicion. her stomach was indeed expanding. Fast. It slowly fought the battle against her hoodie, claiming inch after inch of battlefield on its unstoppable march to full nudity. All was not well on the southern front, either. Sarah felt her sweatpants riding down, forced into a retreat by her rapidly growing rear. When all was said and done, the Sweats had lost Clothes War 2. Her pants were almost on her thighs, with a good portion of her dairy aire in the air. Her once baggy hoodie was now completely unable cover any of her stomach, and now served as a makeshift bra. One that, even then was stretched quite remarkably over her now expanded bust. A later measurement would reveal that she was now a 36GG, but the strangest transformation wasn't even on her body.
         Sarah looked up to see that Nora was as flat as a board . Other than the fact that her Overalls were undone, she showed no signs of ever being pregnant. Looking at her flat body, and her own, now humongous, and almost indecent, body, using the messed up logic of the day, Sarah could only assume one thing; she had somehow put Noras' children into her own womb. Using that information, Sarah once again did the sensible thing.

Sarah screamed her head off. Again.

         "OhmygodohmygodohmyGOD!", A hysterical Sarah screeched, "I just stole the children I gave to you! I'M FUCKING HUGE!!!"
Nora, on the other hand, was quite calm for someone who just had her children snatched.
         "It's for the best I suppose. What use is a womb as unworthy as mine, when children can be brought into this world by a Goddess."
         "I don't wanna bring them into this world! you take them back!"
         "I wouldn't dare take away those children from a womb so sacred, they are yours now." "I dont understand how this could happen! WHY ME?!?!" Sarah screamed. "I'm sure you have many questions, my goddess, and I am grateful for your presence and the greatest honor of touch the holy womb, but I cannot answer your questions.", Nora said.
         "WHY NOT!?!", Sarah screamed, on the verge of tears. "Because"' She replied' "I still a long time to work these fields. But tomorrow I will be free. I will see what I can answer then. In the meantime, consult the Guide, and the unborn, they may provide you with answers far better than I can. Goodbye my goddess." Nora said as she turned to work the fields again, leaving Sarah alone, vastly overdue with, now seven, children who could decide it's time for labor at any moment, almost naked, and in the middle of a field with every farmhand staring at her, slack jawed and bug eyed.

         "Man, you should really try these blackberries! UMMMMPH! I have had the biggest craving for these, and they are to die for!" Olania said. Sarah turned and gave the Goddess a look that could have melted those blackberries.
