144132.content:
Sarah waddled as quickly as she could out of the community farm, hands awkwardly clinging to her sweatpants' waist to keep it from falling down. As she grew up and "matured," Sarah repeatedly ran into the problem of having her chest get in the way of her fitting into clothes, but she never had to deal with an ass so large that it made certain pairs of pants not fit. Of course, the part of her body that was currently making her wardrobe the most difficult was her septuplet belly, jutting out of her body majestically, capturing the attention of everyone in its vicinity: a fact Sarah was horribly embarrassed by.

Sarah left the farm, not noticing that bellies were starting to grow for all of the women working there. "I guess I can't 'give' these babies away to people, but I can take them back if I accidentally make someone else pregnant," Sarah said to herself, looking up and down the streets to decide where she should go. "I shouldn't get too close to anyone from now on. Not that that's a problem for me. The only person I talked to besides Nora was..."

The librarian. Sarah felt her heart sink at the thought of that nice woman swelling up because she spent too much time around Sarah. "Well...the only fair thing to do is take her pregnancy back," Sarah sighed, hurrying back in the direction of the library. Her belly's weight and size made her own sizable hips sway with each step, only drawing more attention to her largely bare rear, save for her gray underwear. At least her conversion of her entire sweatshirt to a bra got rid of the ample cleavage her low zipper was showing, but her breasts were many times larger now and drew their own attention and caused their own discomfort.

At the library, Sarah looked around in a panic as dozens of men and women dropped their books in shock. She waddled her way to the counter, identifying the same woman who helped her. "E-excuse me, I-"

"You're that nice young woman from before," the librarian said with a soft smile. She walked around the counter and revealed her own pregnant belly: not nearly as large as Sarah's, but she looked around 8-9 months pregnant with one. "You've gotten bigger too, I see."

Sarah bit her lip, feeling awful. "Yeah, a-about that. I made a horrible mistake and I need to-"

"You know, I'm going to be 50 in a few weeks and my husband died so long ago. I never thought I'd have children of my own but..." the woman began to cry softly. "Somehow...somehow you did this. Thank you...thank you."

Sarah sighed and gave a little smile. "You're...welcome, ma'am. I just wanted to make sure you're okay."

"See? This is a rewarding job," Oliana whispered in Sarah's ear, wrapping her arm around Sarah's shoulder and jutting their bellies out. As Sarah got bigger, so did she.

Sarah didn't say anything as she tried to push the nude vision of herself as she tried to make her way to the door. But blocking her way were several men and women. "E-excuse me...do you think I could feel your belly?" one woman said, her eyes wide as she reached down one hand to touch Sarah's belly.

"No, don't!" Sarah said, but it was too late. The woman swelled up in an instant, looking overdue with one. With a groan, Sarah put her hand back on the woman's new belly, feeling it deflate as she swelled up. The zipper on her hoodie-bra slowly came down as Sarah's chest reached new heights, her belly throwing her slightly off-balance.

"It's even bigger now," one man said, hands shaking with anticipation as he reached out. Taking a deep breath, Sarah pivoted on one foot and kicked rapidly at the shins of the library's patrons.

"Stay back!" Sarah barked. "I d-don't want to hurt anyone, but even with this big belly, I can kick a lot faster than any of you can step forward." Sarah's red eyes flashed as she readied another kick and the crowd gasped, all moving back quickly. Sarah made a few awkward waddles to the door, looking around, before hurrying out.

"Eight already?" Oliana said, marveling at her own totally-naked belly. "And it's only Day 1. You may be my best incarnation yet, Sarah."

"Shut up, shut up, shut up," Sarah panicked, turning to her smirking doppelgänger. "This is insane! Who would want to be this big? Everyone's staring at me, everyone wants to touch me, and it's hard to even walk around. This is a nightmare."

Oliana gave a little sigh and tapped Sarah on the shoulder. "You'll come to love it, I'm sure. And if you really don't want to be this big for now...here's an opportunity to 'slim down.'" Oliana pointed to a group of women walking perpendicular to Sarah, ready to cross the opposite street. "They're infertile and they've built up good karma. You can pass some of your children onto them," Oliana said, patting Sarah's huge belly, knocking her off-balance a little.

"How?" Sarah said eagerly. Oliana stopped Sarah from walking and put her soft hands on Sarah's temples.

"Close your eyes...picture yourself as the goddess you are. You're hugely pregnant, even bigger than this. You're naked — no, you're in a golden bikini studded with gems. And you're standing on top of a stone ziggurat and you hear chanting and cheering. Down below, it's your people. Men and pregnant women, all here for you. Feel your belly swell with their energy and give that energy back out to the world. Think of those women and their lives with pregnant bellies."

Sarah pictured all of this and let out a long, smooth sigh. When she finished her breath, she opened her eyes to see the women crossing the street now had round, full bellies of their own. She grinned widely, possibly the most she'd ever smiled in public, until she felt a kick inside her. Then a few more. Looking down, Sarah still had an unbelievably big belly, although it was technically "smaller."

"Why am I still pregnant?" Sarah said, hurrying forward again, pulling on her pants to get them around her now slightly-smaller ass.

"Well you didn't give away all of your children, of course. There were only four women there and what kind of pregnancy goddess would have an empty womb?" Oliana chuckled, following Sarah along. "I preferred us when we were pregnant with octuplets, but I suppose four full-term babies is respectable for our first day."

"I need to get this covered up," Sarah said, waddling toward the line of boutiques in town. "There's got to be a maternity clothing store in here."

"And I'm sure they get a lot of business from women 42 weeks pregnant with quadruplets," Oliana laughed, following Sarah, who was obviously ignoring the goddess's voice. "But if you're shopping for clothes to fit your pregnant body, try to get some lingerie too. This frumpy look you're rocking now is cute, but I'd rather see you in something sexy."

"Hi," Sarah said a little too loudly, trying to block out Oliana's voice. The store clerk looked at her in shock. "I'm looking for some...fitting maternity clothes. Do you have anything in my size?"

The clerk thought Sarah was some sort of prankster in a fake belly, but as a few feet and elbows made their marks on the otherwise smooth surface of Sarah's belly, it was clear that this was the real deal. "I-I'm not sure if we have anything to fully...fit you. We do tailor some specialty clothing and we may have to do that with you."

Sarah gulped and put her hands on her hips. Having to order specially-made clothing. She had a flashback to when she nervously had to tell the clerks at the store that, while she was barely a teenager, she didn't fit any of the training bras they offered her. "Fine, that works."

"That means we'll need...measurements," the clerk said, waving in an employee with a tape measure, which was immediately dropped when the employee saw Sarah. "You can go in the back for privacy."

Sarah felt her chest tighten with anxiety. "A-actually, I'm not sure if I want to-"

"Would you prefer a female employee did the measurements instead?" the clerk asked. Sarah knew that if that happened, the employee would have a belly as big as hers by the end of the fitting.

"N-no...could I have a woman sit in on the fitting?" Sarah said, face getting bright red. The clerk nodded and led Sarah into the back. She stood up, spreading her arms, body shaking.

"Just relax, they're professionals," Oliana said, looking directly at Sarah as the tape measure was pressed against her side for the first measurement.

"I don't know if I can..." Sarah said quietly, tears starting to well up in her eyes. A life of trauma and anxiety made this whole thing even more terrifying."

"Close your eyes again," Oliana said, her voice changing from Sarah's to the original, powerful voice Sarah first heard her use. As Sarah closed her eyes, the glowing, fiery bronze form she took in her first dream appeared. "Breathe, my child. You do not need to be afraid. You are strong, you are brave, you are glorious."

Oliana brought her hands to Sarah's cheeks, and even though it was just a vision, Sarah could feel her warm embrace. "We're done, miss." Sarah opened her eyes and saw the two employees standing a few feet away from her. "Are you doing alright?"

"Fine. I'm fine," Sarah said, wiping one eye and hurrying back to the counter. Paying for her custom clothes, Sarah was back out on the street, no Oliana in sight. "Why can't you be that helpful all the time?" Sarah grumbled as she headed back to her house.
144132.title: Settle your debts

1441321.content:
Sarah somehow managed to find her way to her house without any other incident, much to her elation. Here, she was free of those who wished her harm. Here, she was free from the catcallers and the overly flirtatious. Here, she was alone. But it looked like that was no longer the case these days. The four invaders of her womb started to squirm inside her to prove her point. Sarah shuttered. Years of medical training and Countless PhD’s told her that this was completely normal, and in fact cause for celebration, but the only thing Sarah could think of was the “Alien” movie, and how the xenomorphs would burst out of the host’s stomach. It felt unnatural to her, that these living things are inside of her. Of course, it didn't help that the children were, in fact, unnatural, and it was all her fault.
         As if her name was Beetlejuice, Sarah found the Goddess splayed out on the couch, her belly in her lap, flipping through her TV channels, and casually pleasuring herself. Upon seeing Sarah’s look of incredulousness, Olania shrugged.
         ”Hey, I have needs too. Just because I am a goddess, doesn't mean I don't get hot under the collar every once in awhile.” She said, rising from the piece of furniture without any trouble and gliding her way to the baffled woman.
         ”It is nothing to be ashamed about dear, it is a part of the human body. In fact, it can actually help alo…”

CRUNCH!!!

         Sarah’s fist connected with Olania’s nose much harder than she was going for. A blow like that would have caused a concussion on a normal human being, and would have easily broken her pretty nose. Olania, though, merely stumbled back and clutched her face. She didn't care though, as she was blinded by pure, seething rage. Sarah was done.
         ”Shut up! I don’t care!” she screamed, “I am finished with you, with your cult, with these….these….things inside of me, and with this whole goddamned day! I have had my body stolen from me, oogled by the entire damn city, had someone elses grubby little hands all over me, and talked to a loon who thinks I am a God! Newsflash, I don’t know what you are, but you are not a God, and I am definitely not one either! I do know, however, that you caused all of this, and I don’t care who or what you are, because right now, you are gonna be the one to FUCKING FIX ME NOW!!!”
          Sarah breathed heavily, done with her rant. She did not care about anything else, just that this nightmare end, and that she had finally told Olania off, but when the goddess removed her hands from her face, one look was all it took for Sarah to realize she had royally screwed up.
         The reflection of Sarah violently changed into the bronzed form once more, but this time, the warm glow of her skin was harsh and blinding, and the comforting warmth that radiated from her now burned and sizzled. The figure raised a hand towards Sarah, and immediately the red eyed woman gasped and screamed. Her extended stomach shot forwards, outwards, and grew in all directions, her custom bought clothing tearing almost instantly. Later, Sarah would count that she now has twelve, 42 week unborn children residing in her womb, but that wasn’t all.
          Sarah could feel her insides ignite with movement. What was once little nudges and squirming, was now forceful and violent kicks and punches. She could see her stomach visibly distend with each movement, causing quite a lot of pain, and they were all kicking at once. After a time, Sarah noticed that the Distortions of her skin were growing bigger, and her stomach was increasing in weight. She realized that the children were growing, as well as multiplying. She later would learn, after buying a new scale (she broke her first one weighing herself), shuttering at its readings, and crunching some numbers, that each child now weighed about 12 pounds. But that was not her concern right now. Her only thought was pain, and it was only getting worse.
         Sarah’s troubled belly suddenly became extremely hard, and she could feel an impossibly large child shoot its way through her birth canal, too fast to happen naturally, and stop near her lips. Her instincts told her to push, and boy did she, but after several tries, it was clear that this baby was too big too arrive naturally. but it still pushed, and Sarah could feel another child line up behind it. She also had feeling that the child being too big was on purpose, but she had no clue what gave her that idea.
         Sarah knew she had to push, but this thing was not coming out, and it felt like she was being ripped in half. To top it off, waves of Nausea hit the struggling woman, and she threw up almost immediately all over herself, and couldn’t stop. Soon, soreness and tiredness began wash over her as well, and she was consumed by horrid pains all over her body, especially in her breasts as they suddenly began to stream colostrum , as well as complete and utter exhaustion. For the cherry on top, it appeared that Sarah had lost control of her bowels too, and wet herself repeatedly.
          Sarah was sure she was about to die, either from the unborn ripping her stomach open, or from the lack of energy to push out the impossible child, when Olania finally spoke, her voice now booming and intense, over Sarah’s tormented screams.
         ”You dare doubt my godhood now?” She boomed, ”Never strike me again. You are the the next incarnation of Olania. You will be taught to use your gifts, and you will accept it! This is who you are! Do you understand?”
         ”p..p..ppuh..please….” was all Sarah could say.
         ”DO YOU UNDERSTAND?!?!?”
         ”y..yy...ye..yes”
         ”Great!” the goddess said,beaming, the roaring inferno of fertility changing back into a naked Sarah in the blink of an eye, taking all of the symptoms with it. “Isn’t this gonna be fun? You can be the Karate Kid to my Mr. Miyagi!”
          Sarah stood, frozen in shock, covered in every horrible bodily fluid possible, unsure of how to proceed. Luckily, Olania knew exactly just that.
         ”Aw honey, you are in a state! let me get that for you.”
         Sarah blinked, and suddenly she was perfectly clean, but still very naked and belly newly expanded belly had not shrunk. Sarah, for her part, was struggling to complete a sentence.
         ”Wha...I….Buh...Buh…”
         ”Now, I am not going to let you get off scot free for that little ‘incident.’ So, until you learn how to control your powers, your belly is staying that way.”
         Sarah’s eyes widened. Her knees were starting to shake from the weight of her womb, and both of her forearms were tensed and straining to keep her belly off the ground. She could barely stand, let alone move to go to work, or get basic necessities, or have any sort of life outside of this belly. Plus, she was pretty sure that there wasn’t any clothes that could fit her body like this, custom made or otherwise. How was she going to do anything like this?
         ”Hey Sarah, I heard you were sick, so I decided to give you a surprise visit with some goodies! Now I know you hate unexpected visitors, but believe me when WOAH!”
         Sarah gasped and turned around as fast as her heavily laden body would allow, only for the gravid orb to smack a young man, bringing him down to the floor, a bag of cans of chicken noodle soup and pastries flying after him. He lifted the mop of sandy colored hair from his wood bark eyes, only to see a mountain of flesh above him. hurriedly scurrying back, he saw Sarah in all her naked, fertile glory. Sarah was at a loss of words, and so was Olania, But that, as Sarah noticed when she quickly craned her head behind her, was because the Goddess was nowhere to be found. She turned her head back to her only friend, wide eyed, and on her living room floor.
         ”Sarah?” Marshall asked, “Is that you?”
         ”I...uhhh..wha….buh..” was all Sarah managed to eek out, before her knees finally buckled, and her massive womb came crashing to the floor with a hearty, meaty SMACK!!! The impossibly pregnant woman tried with all of her remaining strength, but to no avail. She was immobile for the time being.
         ”Sarah” Marshall asked, “what happened to you?”
          This was the final straw that broke the camels back, and with all the shock to the systems, the emotional turmoil, and the ordeals she just went through today, It was finally to much for Sarah. and she burst into tears, a huge crying fit.
         ”I don’t know!” She said in between huge, heaving sobs, “What is happening to me?”
1441321.title: Things Come to a Head

14413212.content:
”94…..95,” Sarah grunted, the exertion of lifting the 200 pound weight starting to cause strain on her muscles.
         ”96…..97,” Her unborn, whom Marshall had lovingly dubbed, “The Horde”, had long ago started to squirm and maneuver in a space that had no extra room, and caused quite a bit of pressure for the woman. She thought that they may have started around 20 or 25.
         ”98…...99,” The pressure was unbearable sometimes. Sarah constantly felt tight, and like she might burst at any minute. She hoped that if she did explode, she would not spill her guts on Marshall, who was right beside her.
         ”Come on Sarah, that is enough, you have had your workout today. Good job! Now put down the Barbell.”
         ”........100.” Sarah gasped, placing the weight back on her shoulders and returning to the squatting position.
         ”Thank god its over.” Marshall mumbled.
         ”........101.” Sarah gasped, once again rising.
         ”Oh hell no. Sarah drop the weight!” Marshall scrambled behind the woman, and tried the weight off Sarah’s hands. This act of intervention, though, only served to have Sarah lose the center of balance that is critical for a woman pregnant with 12, and tumble backwards on her ass. Luckily, Marshall managed to avoid death by womb and rolled away.
         ”Oh shit! I am so sorry! Are you okay? You need Help up?” Marshall babbled on. He raced toward her side, but Sarah waved him off.
         ”No! I am going to do this on my own. I have to able to do this on my own. Otherwise, these past two months will have been a waste.”
         The past two months have been anything but a waste for Sarah. Well, maybe the first day. The rest of that day was spent with Sarah inconsolable, with marshall having no idea what to do, as well as wondering why his best friend was now huge, and naked on the floor.
         Marshall was probably the only friend Sarah had ever had that she felt like she could be herself around. For the longest time, when Sarah made friends, she would always have to hide herself in baggy attire, for if any of them would find out what she really looked like, the conversation would always change too “Wow! You look great! I don’t know why you hide in those clothes.” or “Hey, there is this cute guy I know that would be perfect for you! You want me to set a date?” and Sarah would always fall out of contact.
         Marshall was different though. Sarah remembered when they first met. She had just gotten hired at the university, and was over the roof when she arrived at the lab. Finally, she could work in peace, and learn more about the world. It was hot that day, and he had decided to wear a cute blouse under her labcoat. Sure, it revealed waaay too much cleavage for Sarah to ever be comfortable with, but on this murky day, it was just light enough to get by. Imagine her surprise when she turned to find Marshall right behind her. To say the timid woman was startled was an understatement. Marshall, for his part, only smirked, said, “So you have been given grants for this too? Well, it looks like we are lab partners.”, and turned and went straight to work.
         Sarah had no idea what to say. Usually, people were dumbfounded and speechless when they first saw her, not the other way around. Here she was, in a very attractive blouse, and this man had blown her off! Sarah was unsure what to do, so she followed his lead and went straight to work.
         When asked him about that first meeting much later in their friendship, he only shrugged.
         ”It didn’t matter who you were, or what you looked like,” he said, “the work was more important.”
         Marshall meant it too. All that day, he didn’t once so much as glance at her breasts. He was always looking at her face, asking for her help, and slowly being more and more impressed with her depth of knowledge. For Sarah’s part, she was amazed at this man who valued her mind over her body. So few people ever saw that in her. From then it was only a matter of time until the two became great friends, and a friend was something Sarah Desperately needed on that first day.
         Sarah told Marshall everything. She had to, otherwise she would lose her mind, and Marshall was hard pressed to disbelieve her, seeing as how the evidence was right in front of him, huge and squirming. Together, they worked out a plan. Well, Marshall worked out a plan, while Sarah carried on with her panic attack. First, Sarah called in to the university, and told them of her aunt, whose cancer had relapsed rather conveniently, so she would have to take absence so she could take care of her. The University understood. Sarah was a huge get for the institute, and most certainly didn’t want her to quit.
         While her job was taken care of, she was still naked, and almost immobile, and there was really only one way to fix these things. The next two months saw Sarah undergo an intensive strength training regimen. It was definitely a switch up from her usual routine, as Sarah always worked her whole body, and was rewarded with a nice, toned body, with muscles that, while not too big, were still impressive.
         All that was thrown out the window, as Sarah now solely focused on her arm, leg, and back muscles. Anything that could help her support her gargantuan stomach. The first couple days were incredibly rough. Sarah could barely move at all, and was forced to drag her belly across the ground and pull it like it was some bag of rocks. She still thinks she feels the rug burn, although that could just be underbelly constantly being sore, her knees always bumping into it when she walked. That was the weird thing. Sarah had yet to go into labor. Here she was, about two months “overdue” and had yet to feel a single contraction. She worried if the children will ever come out.
         Sarah was an expert on fitness, though, and with determination, and incredibly hard, and painful, work, Her efforts were starting to pay off. Her biceps, once fit and toned, now rippled as the Muscles, giant now, struggled against the weight of her unborn, the sinews and strands on her back straining with their newfound power. Soon enough. Her new, powerful legs muscles took purchase, and Sarah was now completely upright by her own volition for the first time in two months. Sarah never wanted big muscles, but now that she had them, they were quite useful.
         ”Congrats” Marshall said, his tone conveying the exact opposite of what he was saying, “now maybe you can stop pushing yourself so hard. Whether you like it or not, those babies well being is on you.”
         ”Yes, Marsh, thank you so much for reminding me that I am pregnant. I don’t know how I would have ever remembered.” The sarcasm was dripping off of her every word. “Besides, there are plenty of studies that show no correlation to strength training and birth defects. You know that.”
         ”I know, but it still makes me uncomfortable.”
         ”Try living with a dozen tiny humans in your stomach, who think its Wrestlemania, and talk to me about uncomfortable.” Sarah softened when she saw the look on her friends face. She knew his worrying was out of care for his friend, and she could understand that.
         ”Look, for the first time since my ‘horde’ spawned, I am able to move on my own. Its a big achievement, but I still have a long way to go. I still have to have at least one arm holding up my belly at all times to keep it up, or I hit the floor, and you have seen how fast I can waddle.”
         ”I know” Marshall relented, “but it doesn't mean you have to push yourself so hard.”
         “Tell you what,” Sarah said, “lets take a break for now. Now that I finally can move somewhat, why don’t we focus our efforts on my main problem, and I can lessen the workouts for now, okay?”
         Marshall nodded in agreement, “Alright, Deal. I will go get your laptop.” he said, rushing into the other room.
         ”Get my spare bra while you’re at it!” Sarah yelled at him. Clothing was the one thing Sarah had to say she failed on. Try as she might, she just could not find any clothes that fit her “proportions” no shirts, pants, anything. The most she found was a custom bra maker, that could make one for her, now 36HH, breasts. They were expensive though, and had a two week shipping period. At least now, combined with the fact that her belly is so big now, it covers her womanhood for her, she was at least (semi)decent.
         Marshall came running back, a bra in one hand and a computer in the other. He presented them as if victories of conquest.
         ”For you, my heavily laden maiden! We can now begin work on the main problem!”
         Sarah glared at her friend, and snatched the items from his hands. A quick hooking and logging on, and She was Ready to tackle her main problem; The Church of Olania. She knew they were an ancient order, but not much else. Hell, her trip to the library only gave her the name of one member. For the first time since she met her, Sarah wished Olania were here, so she could question her for more information about the Church, and if there was a way to reverse this, but Olania had not reappeared since that day she had lost her temper.
         She realized she was going to have to do some deep research, dig under every source, and spend months looking for a single lead. She was prepared to keep at this, no matter how long…
         ”Wha..? Sonofabitch, they have a Facebook Page!”
         Welp, that was easy.
14413212.title: Two Months Later

choices: A call from work. Sarah needs to come in now
144132122.content:
Sarah shook out her long white hair while she looked through the cult's Facebook page. For exercising, it was tied in a ponytail, but she always found it restricted the flow of ideas through her genius brain. It felt tight, and with an 11-month 12-baby pregnancy currently going on inside her womb, things were already tight enough for Sarah's tastes.

There wasn't a lot of information for Sarah to gather. There was no physical address for a meeting place listed and no email or phone number to use to contact members. The page's timeline was certainly interesting. Up until they met Sarah, there were only a few cryptic messages, mixed with some messages telling non-cult members following that "All pictures of pregnancy on this page hold religious significance. Stop commenting on how 'hot' they are."

When Sarah was visited by Nora and the others, there was a flurry of messages where the members seemed to be talking in code, coordinating when and where to meet to visit Sarah. Then came stray pictures of Sarah on her first day with the belly, struggling just to waddle down the sidewalk. These also came with various comments talking about how "hot" and "sexy" Sarah was. Then, since Sarah's self-imposed exile, there was silence.

"A lot of good this does," Sarah sighed, resting her cheek in her hand. Clicking on the "Likes," section, Sarah saw one familiar-looking name: Nora Velden. If Sarah had any doubts of whether it was the same Nora from the cult, her profile picture did away with them. It was Nora's same smiling face with curly black hair resting on her shoulders. And out in front of her was a large pregnant belly.

Sarah felt her heart race as she clicked on Nora's name and looked at her profile. Nora's last few pictures featured her standing in her community garden, belly pushing out her dirty overalls. "Every time I feel them kick, I feel so blessed!" Nora's caption read.

"B-but I got rid of her pregnancy," Sarah muttered. "I took it for myself."

"Lucky her," Oliana said, looking over Sarah's shoulders. "Looks like she had some good karma."

Sarah yelped and spun around, taking a few steps away from the goddess who looked just like her. The last time Oliana was around, Sarah ended up being the size of a bus. She'd just gotten used to her size after months of hard exercise and she didn't feel like repeating it. As Sarah let out long breaths, staring down Oliana, she noticed something was different: Oliana wasn't pregnant. Or naked.

"That's how you greet me after two months away?" Oliana pouted, putting her hands on her wide hips. Unlike her past times visiting Sarah, Oliana had on a bikini that was as bright white as her hair. A smile spread across her lips and her gleaming red eyes narrowed. "Say...you're looking awfully agile."

"I've had some time to get adjusted," Sarah said. "And I don't need to know what it's like to carry 24 fetuses, so no funny business."

"Hey, hey, it's fine," Oliana smiled, hands up. "Friends, see? Well, more than friends. You're me, in a way. We have to stick together. Don't tell me you weren't thinking about how much you missed me."

Oliana had a point. Sarah was wondering when she'd show up and explain more about this whole "pregnancy goddess" thing. Or at least take the burden off of her. "I suppose you're the only person I can really talk to about all this," Sarah said, resting her hands on both sides of her belly. "It's weird not seeing you with one too."

"It feels weird," Oliana smiled, twirling around to show off her beach body. "Since you threw a tantrum, I decided to take a little vacation. The beaches of Rio de Janeiro, the hot springs of Oslo, the resorts of Okinawa."

"D-dressed like that?" Sarah blushed. "People couldn't see you, could they?"

"Of course," Oliana beamed, running her hands down her waist. "I had to sacrifice my powers and my lovely belly to be corporeal for a while, but it was worth it. Don't I look a little more tanned?"

"But that's my body!" Sarah shrieked. "P-people saw me in that revealing outfit?"

Oliana giggled. "Some people got to do a lot more than look, dear. Speaking of which," Oliana got close to Sarah and looked out the door at Marshall, who was on the couch, not hearing Sarah talk to herself. "I see you've got someone in your life now. Does he like the belly?"

Sarah got embarrassed a lot in her life, but she had never blushed hotter or brighter than when Oliana asked her that question. "I-I-I cannot believe you would ask that!"

Oliana sighed and smiled. "Sarah, my sweet girl." She shushed Sarah as Marshall peered over, hearing Sarah's squealing outburst. "It's okay. You're not the first one of my incarnations who was still a v-"

"Don't say it," Sarah fumed, lifting a muscular arm. "It hurt plenty when I socked you before, right? Well imagine if I did it this time."

Oliana laughed, a little divine bronze glow shimmering along her skin. "Fine, fine. But you do want to talk with me, don't you?"

Sarah rested one hand on her belly and nodded, walking back to her computer. "Why is Nora pregnant again? I took her babies back from her when I accidentally made her pregnant with quadruplets."

Oliana looked at the screen, a smile across her lips. "But she looks so happy. Why did you take it away?"

"Oliana..."

"Staying on topic, sorry!" Oliana laughed. "Anyway, you've held her in good graces for a long time, so she's getting what she wants: a big, healthy pregnancy."

"What do you mean?" Sarah said, crossing her arms across her heaving chest.

"You're a god, sweetie. You answer prayers, so to speak. People close to you and people you like, if it's for long enough, will get pregnant on their own and have amazing children," Oliana said. "Deep down, you must have really liked Nora."

"Do you know anything about her?" Sarah asked. "I want to find her and she's the head of your church, after all."

Oliana shrugged. "Eh, it's an unofficial fan club. I know very little about them."

"Sarah?" Marshall said, from the other room. "Everything okay? You've been at the computer for a while. Learn anything?"

"That's my cue," Oliana winked, giving Sarah a kiss on the cheek while rubbing her belly. "Despite our little...confrontation, I'm still so proud of you, Sarah."

"Wait, don't go yet!" Sarah said. "Can't you make me smaller?"

"Smaller?" Oliana said, looking at her with confusion. "Why would you ever want to be less pregnant?" With that, Oliana vanished in a golden flicker as Marshall walked into the room.

"You haven't even changed out of your exercise clothes yet," Marshall said, trying to keep his eyes up. Sarah's sports top didn't exactly conceal her cleavage. "What's up?"

"I-I just..." Sarah stalled, before something clicked in her head. "Actually, let me try something." Sarah was more focused on physical sciences than computers, but she was good enough at mathematics to be able to code and, more importantly, hack. Sarah didn't have a Facebook account of her own, for obvious reasons, so with some programming that felt rudimentary to her, Sarah had lots of information about Nora. Address, phone number, her college transcripts for some reason.

"Looks like you'll be able to reach out to her after all," Marshall said, still a little in awe of how quickly Sarah managed to put that all together. "But what do you think you'll manage to talk about?"

"Don't know," Sarah said, rubbing her belly. "But if she likes being pregnant so much, maybe she won't mind taking some of the burden off of me." Sarah turned to Marshall and gave a little smile. "N-now I need you to step out again. I'm sweaty and gross and I need to change."

"R-right," Marshall nodded quickly, darting out of the room. Sure, he'd seen Sarah pregnant and nude for a few seconds once, but she still kept her naked body carefully guarded. It was a huge step that she let him see her with an uncovered belly at all. Stepping into the shower, Sarah detached the head and sprayed it all over her body, sighing and moaning as she felt her muscles ache. Looking down at her meaty biceps, Sarah felt another wave of self-consciousness come. People were already looking at her like she was a demon with her hair and eyes (if they weren't already ogling the rest of her body), and with huge muscles, she would only stand out more.

"Guess you kind of take most of the credit for that, though," Sarah sighed, rubbing her soapy belly. A kick made Sarah smile a bit. Honestly, and she hated to admit it, but she was getting used to being pregnant. Parts of it made her kind of happy now. She felt less awkward being naked because it wasn't really her body anymore. And when the kicks weren't making her keel over with their tightness or hitting her in the bladder were a little cute.

After showering and squeezing into the baggiest clothes she could find, Sarah stood by the door, hands on her hips. "Now, let's see how much Nora likes it when someone shows up at her doorstep uninvited."
144132122.title: Olania Reappears

choices: Sarah has to interact with other employees, all growing bellies
1441321222.content:
At that moment, Sarah felt a buzzing in his pocket. She raised a confused eyebrow and reached in, pulling out her large, clumsy cellphone. Sarah was far too shy and protective of her identity to get anything fancier than an early 2000s Nokia that was only good for calls in and out. And she barely got or made any calls anyway. But the limited caller I.D. the phone's display allowed for told her it was work so she answered as quickly as she could. Reaching into her pockets was hard with nearly 100 pounds of swollen womb in front of her. And no matter how baggy the pants she found were, her pregnancy, coupled with her pre-existing natural beauty, meant her hips and ass were so large that her pockets were as tight as a vicegrip.

"Hello?" Sarah said on her end, looking at Marshall with an unsure gaze.

"Sarah! Good to hear your voice after so long," Margaret, Sarah's supervisor at the lab, said, sounding worried and out of breath. "H-h-how's your aunt doing?"

Right, her aunt and her missteps into bad health. The reason Sarah gave for her inability to come into work for the past months to hide the fact that she was the most pregnant woman on the planet at the moment. "Um, doing well," Sarah nodded. Lying made her uneasy and it was not among her various skills.

"Great, that's great to hear!" Margaret said, on the verge of nervous laughter. "So...would it be alright if you came back to the lab today? Since she's doing better?"

Sarah paused and looked down at her belly. "Well..."

"See...we've run into a bit of a problem over here," Margaret said, trying her best to sound sane. "There have been some mix-ups and some misunderstood communications between ourselves and several of the groups that give us grants. We're...overbooked, let's say, and we need to deliver on research and progress on our experiments on a very, very short turnaround."

"I see," Sarah gulped, looking at Marshall with a worried look. He'd never mentioned anything about this.

"Yes, and the IRS is also visiting us...regularly," Margaret said. "And we were all thinking, gosh, you know who always seemed to juggle a lot of work easily and quickly with high quality? Sarah!" Margaret began laughing nervously again, trying to drown out the sound of shouting in the background of her phone call. "So what do you say? Come back at least until this is all cleared up?"

Sarah sighed and felt a few kicks along the side of her belly, disturbing her already uneasy wardrobe. "Sure, Margaret, I'll come in. But you should know...I look a little different than I did a few months ago."

"Oh, we understand," Margaret said. "Taking care of a sick loved one can be very stressful and it can drain the color from you...although in your case-"

"Right," Sarah nodded. "A-anyway, like usual, I'd like privacy while I work." She turned to her one friend in the world and smiled. "But Marshall will still be working with me, if that's fine."

"Whatever you need!" Margaret exclaimed before clearing her throat and calming down. "I-I mean, that's all fine. If you need anything else, just ask and we'll see if we can accommodate you."

Sarah hung up and turned to Marshall, resting one hand on her massive middle. "Looks like I'm going back to work."

"Seriously?" Marshall said, his jaw dropping. "But your...you know..."

"Belly? Not much I can do about that," Sarah sighed, rubbing her gut as she waddled out the door. "We've got a lot of work to do, so make sure to dig in deep."

"And try not to knock over too many beakers with your stomach, Sarah," Marshall chuckled as Sarah blushed and looked down. "Sorry, did that go too far?"

"No, it's good advice," Sarah said quietly as she gave her belly a soft stroke. "Let's go."

-----

As Sarah and her lab partner approached the doors of the massive lab, Margaret rushed out, an enormous smile on her face. "Sarah! So glad you could make it! And Marshall, good to see you t-" Margaret stopped talking instantly, her face a mask of total befuddlement as her legs continued to move her closer to Sarah.

"Hi," Sarah mumbled as she tried to move a little quicker. "L-like I said, I look a little different."

"R...ight," Margaret nodded, her eyes as big as coffee saucers. "Well...congratulations?"

"Thanks," Sarah blushed as she continued to move. "Where do you need me the most?"

"Let me, um, lead the way," Margaret said, opening doors for Sarah as she waddled through. Her improved physique helped her mobility, but not so much that her pregnant gait was eliminated. And even if she'd mastered walking in her current state, with an 11-month, 12-baby belly, it would still sway back and forth considerably with each step, as it did now. "You look like you've been working out too. I mean, I knew you did a lot of martial arts, but you really look buff now."

"She's a machine when it comes to weights," Marshall chimed in with a grin. "You've never seen someone lift with such determination and single-mindedness."

"Marshall..." Sarah whispered, her cheeks turning redder as she grabbed her lab coat off of its rack. It barely fit at all now but it still mattered to her as a status symbol. It showed that, despite being hugely pregnant, despite learning that she's a reincarnated god, Sarah was still Sarah.

"Here we are," Margaret said, showing them into a vacated lab. "The information we have so far is on the center counter and all the supplies you should need are there as well, but if you need anything, feel free to contact us via intercom." She let out another nervous laugh and hugged Sarah tightly. "I know it's unprofessional, but you have no idea what a big help you are do us by doing this!"

"Y-you're welcome," Sarah said, her arms twitching as she held them by her side awkwardly. When Margaret broke the hug, she gave one last sigh and smile before leaving, pressing one hand against her gurgling belly as she moved.

"Back at last," Marshall sighed, moving to the center counter and looking over the data. "It's going well so far, wouldn't you say?"

"So far," Sarah nodded, crossing her arms as she looked around.

"Enough that you'd...maybe consider coming back to work like usual?" Marshall asked. "It's sucked not having you around. Everyone else here is a moron. Me included."

"Give yourself more credit," Sarah said with a little smile. "I trust you to be my lab tech, don't I?"

"True," Marshall said, letting out a gasp and hurrying over as Sarah's belly hit a cabinet full of chemicals, grabbing it before it fell. "L-let's get started, huh?"

"Yeah," Sarah blushed. "Let's."

15112211.content:
The museum was an impressive structure. Sarah paused for a moment outside the entrance to admire the masonry. Despite her situation, she thought it was important to take stock. She had never been here before. Most of Sarah's life was built around rigorous self maintenance of both body and mind. She did not often go out to experience simple pleasures, which was something she had begun to desire more and more. Success had not been as fulfilling as she had expected. While she would never wish away her accomplishments, for they provided her a measure of privacy and safety, there was something undefinable missing from her daily life. Perhaps it had something to do with her poor social skills.

         Sarah was shy, and bad public speaker. Her list of friends was terribly short, and they all lived several states away. She could confidently call them meaningful friends, but they had never quite been able to break her out of her shell. It had taken a lot of time to get to know each other, and this was partly because Sarah was always busy thinking. This meant that Sarah was awful at hiding her current discomfort. She had picked the best clothes that she could, with moderate success. Rather than wear one of her dresses that would have suited her condition better, Sarah was wearing a combination of exercise clothes, a black cap, and a purple hoodie. Her white hair was tied in a ponytail, and overall she looked like she was trying to hide herself.

         This was impossible. Sarah's body had always stood out, and now even more so. There were also few people that had red irises, which she hid behind sunglasses. In the backpack that she hauled was the statue, wrapped in cloth. She had begun to feel uneasy carrying the thing with her, as if its effects could worsen at any time. This whole issue was insane.

         When she reached the front desk, almost everyone was stealing a glance at her. Nobody present knew her personally, but they were aware of her presence in town. Why this wealthy recluse would come here today, how beautiful she was, and who could possibly be the father of her child, were among the many thoughts present. The receptionist pointed her towards Annie Patron's office, and she hustled over as quickly as she could.

         Annie was more or less shocked at what she saw. "Oh, wow, Sarah! You never mentioned anything like this. Congratulations!"
"Yes, well, it's actually a problem."
"Oh, don't say that! You must be tired from walking here. Ankle swelling and all that."
"No. I actually need you to look at that statue I mentioned."
"Right. May I see it?"

         Sarah placed the statue on a nearby desk. Annie smiled as she began to examine the small sculpture. "It's well made," she noted. "It's surprising that this sculpture is painted; someone must have really treasured it. A bit perverted looking, though." Annie picked up the sculpture to examine the base, which gave Sarah a start. She hoped that its magic wouldn't affect Annie as well. She couldn't live with herself if that happened.

"Spiritus Catinum is written on the bottom," Annie said, "in marker. What a way to treat good art. I could see about removing that if you would like to donate this."
"No," Sarah said quickly. Although she was uncomfortable around the enchanted statue, she was even more afraid of it getting out into public. "I just wanted to see if you knew anything about it."
"Well, it reminds me of something, but I can't quite put my finger on it. Maybe I can get back to you later. Thanks for bringing it over, and I hope you change your mind about keeping it. Then again, it's a great way to celebrate the baby, right?"

         Sarah felt miserable on her way home, statue in tow. As she drove, her mind shifted inevitably toward her condition. She had not felt any kicks or fluttering in her stomach, which she surely would have felt by now. The implications of that were troubling. Under normal circumstances, it would be a possible sign of a miscarriage, which would be an even more horrible discovery after waking up like this. Instead, however, Sarah felt what seemed to be a kind of thrum, and a gentle heat. It was an odd sensation, and she subconsciously kept a hand on her stomach, as if to listen more carefully.

         The words written on the statue were a clumsy attempt by the previous owner, she expected, to sound smart. If they had written in English, she expected he would have written the words "spirit" and "crucible." She didn't want to leap to conclusions based on such a simple discovery, but she had an active imagination. Could it be, if magic were real in some capacity, that she was not carrying a human child? Or, if magic weren't real as was most likely, could she have grown a tumor overnight? Her concerns were halted when she reached her home. There were strange lights emanating from the yard.

         The acre of land that constituted her front yard was full of fireflies. As she went up the driveway, she slowed down to gaze at the marvelous display. She had never seen so many, or any that shone quite so brightly. It was beautiful. When she parked, Sarah walked to her front door and turned to look back. The lights were blinking in and out as they hovered in the air. Many were slowly approaching her. She noticed an envelope had been left on her doorstep, and decided to read it in the lamplight.

Dear Sarah,

         My name is Jun. I'm sorry that I didn't speak with you yesterday. Quite frankly I was nervous. I owe your family a great debt, and I couldn't put it into words. I've decided to try to communicate my feelings properly in this letter. It was many years ago when your parents saved my life. I used to work at a monastery. Your parents were travelers, and passing through to learn about our religion. Now, at the time I was going through a very difficult period, and I was losing my faith. It became so bad that I needed someone to physically intervene, and your parents did so. They asked for nothing in return, only that I pay it forward. Even greater, they kept tabs on my condition, and regularly checked in with my superiors. But one day the letters stopped coming. It was a long time afterwards when I heard about you, and that your parents had passed on. You may not know my religion, but suffice to say that we believe in a form of purgatory, and that the ghosts of the dead travel the earth for eternity in hopes of passing into the next realm. The process of leaving all sins behind is an arduous process, to be sure, but none of us living can fathom the nature and experience of a ghost. It is with trepidation that I describe what the statue I gave you is for.

It is a kind of beacon, built to represent one of our deities. Those that are pure of heart that are gifted this totem are said to be given eternal fortune to their ancestor's wandering souls. It is also said that it allows the recipient to channel those souls, (and any others that they are receptive to) into the next realm. I must confess and apologize that I doubt that you are pure of heart. Nor do I truly think that was the case for your parents. They were good enough, though, to help a wretch like myself. I simply wish to give my dearest thanks to your family, in the only way that a lost soul like mine can. Please forgive me for how awkward this gift must be, but it has a religious significance, and I mean for it to speak metaphorically, not practically. Thank you for the blessing of your family, and many blessings be upon you in the future.

Sincerely,

Jun.

         Sarah was not one to panic. She had many academic and physical accomplishments, and all of them required staying cool under duress. As she lowered the letter, however, she gazed once more upon the immense collection of fireflies polluting her yard. What she felt then, as her mind raced at all of the implications of what would happen, was quite akin to panic. She was frozen. One of the lights was extremely close to her now; it floated gently towards her belly. For a moment she hoped that it had in fact been a firefly, but of course this wasn't true. The light passed through her skin, causing a gentle heat and vibration to occur. For a second she could feel her skin tighten just little, and then relax. She didn't need any more proof. Sarah raced into the house.

         During the previous night possibly dozens of ghosts had found refuge inside of her, and she had no idea how to get rid of them. Worse yet, her home was surrounded now by hundreds of them. Why had they waited for her to return here? Perhaps the totem had marked the area at the same time as her, and this "channeling" could only occur on these grounds. If that was the case, then she would have to stay and attempt some kind of ritual with nothing but an enchanted totem to aid her. The rule was now in place: she was a conduit to the spirit realm, a crucible for these lost souls until she either completed this ritual or somehow canceled it out entirely. For that second option to take place: she would have to make a made dash through the crowd of ghosts back to her car, praying that not too many would reach her before she drove off the grounds, and pray further that they absolutely couldn't follow her. There was no guarantee of that.

Whatever the choice, Sarah was in for an interesting evening.
15112211.title: Sarah gets to the museum

151122111.content:
Sarah took a deep breath. Whatever was going to happen, she would have to do the best she could. With conviction, she walked toward her room, a hand gently brushing the surface of her belly. She had been shocked by how she had transformed as she slept. Now the prospect of becoming even larger was frankly unsettling. It was not permanent, supposedly, but she had no real clues of how to “pass the spirits on to the next realm” as the letter had suggested. She wouldn’t have time to plan, as the spirits were already passing through the walls of her home, drifting towards her.

She placed the statue on her nightstand and laid herself onto her bed. Her thoughts turned to prayer. “Please let me be okay,” she whispered. As she prayed, the spirits began to pass into her stomach. Each one brought a gentle heat and a subtle vibration. Sarah’s stomach seemed to glow as each light entered her. She began to sweat. The skin of her stomach was warm, and she witnessed the surreal process of it expanding before her eyes. Hundreds of spirits were racing into her home, and her room was now full of them. With each spirit, her skin tightened a little more, then relaxed again.

Sarah had looked like she was expecting a single child this morning, merely five minutes into the process, she looked like she was expecting twins. The orb of flesh stood tall and proud, pushing the limits of her shirt. As more spirits poured forth, and the heat increased, Sarah relented and pulled off her clothes. As embarrassed as she felt, she knew they were only going to become a hindrance going forward.

The gentle thrum that she felt began to spread through her entire body, which she found relaxing on her weary muscles. The whole experience was so bizarre, and now there was a guilty pleasure that had arisen in her. There was a subconscious part of her that, against all reason, was finding joy in this experience. She had never really thought about whether she wanted to become a parent, she realized. Perhaps this was one of the things that had been missing in her life.

Light after light came in, and Sarah’s stomach continued to expand and broaden. She looked like she was expecting triplets now, after only half and hour. The rate in which the lights entered her wasn’t consistent, but they were racing furiously around the room. It was as if there was an excitement in them, that they were finally reaching the end of their long journey.

Sarah reached out and grabbed the idol. Whatever deity it represented, she wanted its help now. Sarah had hoped that, through prayer, she could engage whatever process it was that removed the spirits from her. With all of her efforts so far, however, it did not seem to be enough. She thought for a moment that maybe she should leave after all, and ask Annie Patron for more help, that perhaps they could discover whatever process was required. Maybe she could find the strange old man that had left the statue with her.

But Sarah was much heavier now, and she was overwhelmed and panting because of her sudden growth. As she prayed, the statue began to react, and it resonated with a sweet sound. A sound, like a choir, began to permeate the room, attracting the spirits in the air. “What’s going on?” Sarah wondered. The deity had heard her prayers? She didn’t have much time to think, however, as suddenly the spirits became even more hurried. The beautiful sound emanating from the statue was calling them forth into her womb. The hundreds of lights darted into her, and she began to grow at an even greater pace.

Sarah gasped. She looked pregnant with quadruplets at this point. It was overwhelming to see this massive part of herself. Her belly, blooming with motherhood, was growing in every direction. She splayed her hands against the taught skin and felt her belly continue to push out.

When she looked due with quintuplets, Sarah felt a bit afraid of how much longer this would all go on. She was beginning to lose track of time among the tidal wave of emotions that she was feeling. Fear, horror, apprehension, excitement, honor, even lust. For a moment more the thought about leaving to her car came up again. Get out, don’t do this, you have no idea what you’re getting into, she thought. She writhed. Her body wasn’t listening to reason. She thought she might lose herself in the experience.

A glow began to cast from the window into the room. Sarah looked outside, and what she saw gave her pause. Outside it appeared that even more ghosts had appeared. There must have been hundreds in total. All she knew was she was in for the long haul, to help the spirits pass on into the next life, for the moment experiencing a blissful motherhood herself.

They flooded into the room. Her stomach continued to rapidly expand, glistening with sweat in the new light. Sarah moaned. Now, did it look like she was bearing sextuplets, or even more? It was impossible to tell anymore. The statue continued to resonate in her hands, the sound slowly changing as she grew. Sarah was beginning to feel uncomfortable, the skin of her belly pulled more taught than it had ever been. It had grown impossibly during the event, but she supposed it had to be magic at play.

Suddenly, spirits stopped entering her. Sarah gasped, again and again. Every breath felt like her first after being submerged under water for too long. Her belly seemed to glow before her, and as she continued to pray, her wish was finally being granted. The massive mountain of flesh began to decrease in size, slowly returning to her normal state. The process seemed to go on forever. Sarah was overcome with images of countless people. They waved to her in thanks as they disappeared from the Earth.

It was all too much, and Sarah began to cry. She had never imagined that something like this could happen in her life. The enormity of what she was doing was finally sinking in. She looked out again to the plethora of spirits remaining. There were still tons of them. She was helping them. This was real.

Sarah returned to her typical stat, and for a moment she was gleeful to see her stomach as it had been. As she had worked so hard to make it. Despite her reprieve, however, the job was not done. The shimmering lights of the dead began to grow restless. “I’ll do it,” Sarah said, “I will help you cross into the next life.” As she said this, the glimmering lights danced.

It was a long night. Sarah continued to pray with the statue in hand, and the spirits continued to fill her womb. A constant cycle began, new spirits replacing the old ones that left. She had grown once more to the incredible size she had reached at her limit, and she remained in that state for several hours. All the while, Sarah experienced what could delicately be described as bliss.

When the sun rose, Sarah’s job was done. Every spirit that had collected at her home had passed through her into the afterlife. Exhausted, Sarah took the best shower of her life, and returned to bed to sleep. Even though it had ultimately been a fulfilling experience, she hoped that she wouldn't have to go through it again. She couldn’t imagine doing this regularly. Of course, she realized that technically all of the spirits had been her ancestors. That was a little awkward for her to consider, although the letter had stated that she could accept spirits from other families as well.

It was all a little too much. Sarah didn’t want to make a habit out of reliving the previous night. When she awoke, she wrapped up the statue and placed it once more in the box that it came from. Perhaps she would donate it to the museum after all.
